{{Infobox Diplomatic Mission | name = Embassy of the Republic of Poland in Moscow
Ambasada Rzeczypospolitej Polskiej w Moskwie
ÐÐ¾ÑÐ¾Ð»ÑÑÑÐ²Ð¾ Ð ÐµÑÐ¿ÑÐ±Ð»Ð¸ÐºÐ¸ ÐÐ¾Ð»ÑÑÐ° Ð² ÐÐ¾ÑÐºÐ²Ðµ [[Image:Polish Governmental and Diplomatic Plaque.png|175px]] | image = | address = Klimashkina 4, 123-557 Moscow | location = | ambassador = [[Jerzy Bahr]] }} The '''Embassy of Poland in Moscow''' is the [[diplomatic mission]] of the [[Republic of Poland]] to the [[Russian Federation]]. The chancery is located at Klimashkina Street 4, Moscow. The [[List of diplomatic missions of Poland|Polish embassy]] occupies a purpose-built building of modernist design, incorporating Polish national motifs which is sited on a special diplomatic compound just outside Moscow's '[[Garden Ring]]'. The compound is, in accordance with diplomatic protocol, considered part of the territory of the Polish Republic; for this reason the ambassador's residence as well as apartments for a number of other diplomatic staff are located there, alongside the chancery and consular buildings. In recent years the embassy has been the location of a number of protests against the policies of the Polish government. Notably, in recent times, the embassy served as the primary target for groups wishing to express their disagreement with the directives of the late president [[Lech KaczyÅski]].{{cite web|url=http://www.kommersant.com/p600198/r_1/Polish_Embassy%E2%80%99s_2nd_Casualty/|title=Polish diplomat attacked in Moscow, ambassador calls for staff to stay on compound.|date=11 August 2005|publisher=[[Kommersant]]|accessdate=2010-04-13}} The current [[ambassador of Poland to Russia]] is Mr [[Jerzy Bahr]] who presented his credentials to then president [[Vladimir Putin]] at an official reception in the [[Moscow Kremlin]] on 25 July 2006.{{cite web|url=http://www.kremlin.ru/eng/text/news/2006/07/109335.shtml|title=Vladimir Putin accepted the letters of credential from a number of foreign ambassadors.|date=25 July 2006|publisher=[[Presidential Press and Information Office]]|accessdate=2009-03-04}} Image:Moscow, Klimashkina 5.JPG|Polish Embassy complex in Moscow Image:Dmitry Medvedev - Polish Embassy, Moscow.jpeg|Russian president [[Dmitry Medvedev]] pays his respects to the victims of the [[2010 Polish Air Force Tu-154 crash|2010 Polish Government Tu-154 crash]] ==See also== *[[PolandâRussia relations]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== {{commons category|Polish Embassy, Moscow}} *[http://www.moskwa.polemb.net/ Embassy of Poland in Moscow] {{pl icon}} {{ru icon}} {{en icon}} {{Polish diplomatic missions}} {{coord|55|46|03|N|37|34|39|E|region:RU_type:landmark_source:kolossus-ruwiki|display=title}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Embassy Of Poland In Moscow}} [[Category:Diplomatic missions in Moscow|Poland]] [[Category:Diplomatic missions of Poland]] [[Category:PolandâRussia relations]] [[ru:ÐÐ¾ÑÐ¾Ð»ÑÑÑÐ²Ð¾ ÐÐ¾Ð»ÑÑÐ¸ Ð² ÐÐ¾ÑÐºÐ²Ðµ]]
